subject: RE: [junit] Re: writing a test case for a function which returns void
msgSnippet: Yes, you can assert that is has changed the state of the object is was invoked on. ... From: Tariq Qazi [mailto:tariq.qazi@tic.siemens.ca] Sent: 15 August 2001
messageBody:
Yes, you can assert that is has changed the state of the object is was
invoked on.

-----Original Message-----
From: Tariq Qazi [mailto:tariq.qazi@...]
Sent: 15 August 2001 14:27
To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
Subject: [junit] Re: writing a test case for a function which returns
void



Hi,
I am novice in Junit. So bear with me. Does it make sense to write a
test
case for a function which returns
void. For example for a function like

public void Func( int x, int y){


}
